bibl.title: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Laura Eugenia Hook Carter, July 23, 1914

div1.p: Carter reports that the field work has been difficult.

div1.head: Letter from Henry Rose Carter to Laura Eugenia Hook Carter, July 23, 1914
div1.opener:
OFFICE OF
MEDICAL OFFICER IN COMMAND
TREASURY DEPARTMENT
UNITED STATES
PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICE
Juy
Aug 23/14
Dear Laura:
div1.p:
L. last letter reported you as
doing well, exceptionally well,

Yesterday, was not a full day - lanch
broke down about 3.30 & lost us say 1/4 of
of a day. It was not laborious though al-
though aggravating.

I feel sure I can get a way from this
place by the 1st of August - & will try
to make it by the before - 30th of July say.

The work is wearing on me. It is so dirty
& so continuously so. Hitherto it was about
3 days field work & 3 days not. here
it is 6 days a week & the country
is extremely rough. I got
I received L's note enclosing a let-
ter from Henry which I have not read
but will do so now.

I rec'd a wire from White last
night - asking “where can Dr. Rose & my-
self meet you Sunday”. I answer-
ed. “Hamlet N. C.”.

I am not pressing myself so much
as I have been. One cant take things
easy in this work but I am , & will, taking,
& will take, them easyier
I
